SENT.plain: The case reported here is the first observation of thrombophlebitis of the superior sagittal and left transverse sinuses in a patient with systemic lupus erythematosus
Thrombophlebitis occurred thirty-six years after onset of SLE
The patient had neither nephrotic syndrome nor serum anti-coagulants
Various hypotheses concerning pathogenesis are suggested
The opportunity for heparin therapy is discussed
